item.title: When is the BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major? Dates, Times, and Schedule
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/when-is-the-blast-tv-austin-cs2-major-dates-times-and-schedule/

BLAST has officially revealed the dates for the BLAST.tv Austin Counter-Strike 2 Major, which will be the first Major played in North America in more than seven years. The Austin Major will be the third since the release of CS2, but it will certainly be a historic one with the expansion of both the format and the number of invited teams.

Between the new qualifiers, the three separate Swiss stages, and of course the playoffs, there’s a lot of CS2 to watch and a lot of dates to keep in mind. Here’s our breakdown of the full schedule for the BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major.

Before you jump below, consider trying your luck on Clash.gg – you could turn your unwanted skins into something much more valuable (18+ only)

When is the BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major?

The BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major itself runs from June 3, 2025 until the Sunday grand finals on June 22, 2025. Unlike in previous years, where two Swiss Stages determined the eight teams that qualify for playoffs, the Major will utilize three Swiss Stages featuring 32 different teams.

The playoffs will be held in the Moody Center in Austin, Texas, which holds a capacity of 16,223 people.

BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major Full Schedule

The following is the full schedule for the BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major. Dates and times are susceptible to changes.

Regional Qualifiers Schedule

The regional qualifier events will determine which teams qualify to the first stage of the BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major. These qualifiers will consist of the highest ranked teams (according to Valve Regional Standings) that have not already been invited to Stage 2 or Stage 3.

  • European Qualifier – April 14-17
  • Americas Qualifier – April 15-17
  • Asia-Pacific Qualifier – April 15-17

Swiss Stage 1 Schedule

Stage 1 of the BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major is expected to run June 3-6. Stage 1 will consist of 16 teams from the regional qualifiers: six from Europe, six from Americas, and four from Asia-Pacific.

  • Swiss Stage 1, Round 1 and 2: June 3
  • Swiss Stage 1, Round 3: June 4
  • Swiss Stage 1, Round 4: June 5
  • Swiss Stage 1, Round 5: June 6

Swiss Stage 2 Schedule

Stage 2 of the BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major is expected to run June 8-11. Stage 2 will consist of the top eight teams that advance out of Stage 1, the 7th-10th ranked Europe teams, and the 2nd-5th ranked Americas teams.

  • Swiss Stage 2, Round 1 and 2: June 8
  • Swiss Stage 2, Round 3: June 9
  • Swiss Stage 2, Round 4: June 10
  • Swiss Stage 2, Round 5: June 11

Swiss Stage 3 Schedule

Stage 3 of the BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major is expected to run June 13-16. Stage 3 will consist of the top eight teams that advance out of Stage 2, the 1st-6th ranked Europe teams, the number one ranked Americas team, and the number one ranked Asia-Pacific team.

  • Swiss Stage 3, Round 1 and 2: June 13
  • Swiss Stage 3, Round 3: June 14
  • Swiss Stage 3, Round 4: June 15
  • Swiss Stage 3, Round 5: June 16

Playoffs Schedule

The playoffs of the BLAST.tv Austin CS2 Major are expected to run June 19-22. The playoffs is an eight-team single-elimination bracket, consisting of the eight teams that advance out of Stage 3.

  • Quarterfinals: June 19
  • Quarterfinals: June 20
  • Semifinals: June 21
  • Grand Finals: June 22

The expansion of the format means this should be the longest Counter-Strike Major in history, lasting nearly three weeks in total.

Are you tuning into all three stages? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

If you want to unlock free daily cases and rewards in CS2, check out Clash.gg (18+ only)

Stay tuned to Insider Gaming for the latest esports news. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Dauntless Developer Phoenix Labs Lays Off 50+ More Employees, With Studio Likely to Close
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/phoenix-labs-layoffs-closure/

The remainder of Phoenix Labs developers have been laid off, with the studios game ‘Dauntless’ and it’s studio likely to close.

Speaking with now past-employee’s at the studio, it’s understood that around 50 employees have been made redundant today. Several of those employee’s now believe that the Dauntless game is now dead, and that Phoenix Labs is likely to shut down, although Parent company Forte has yet to make such an announcement.

According to those familiar with the situation, no one at Phoenix Labs still has a job with one person saying it was “surprising” that it was announced as round of layoffs instead of a studio closure.

Forte, a blockchain company, acquired Phoenix Labs around summer 2023 and in May 2024 made more than 100 of its staff redundant. Forte was asked to comment, but did not supply one in time ahead of publication.

Following the internal announcement, Phoenix Labs staff took to their Dauntless Discord server to make the announcement of redundancies, where it was said that “Earlier today, the majority of our development team was impacted by significant reductions at Phoenix Labs. This has been a heartbreaking decision for us, and we are deeply saddened for the talented individuals who are affected.”

The statement continued, “We know you may have questions about what this means for Dauntless and its future. While we don’t have all the answers at this time, we are committed to keeping you informed and will share updates as soon as we can.”

“Your support means the world to us, and we are truly grateful for this incredible community. Thank you for standing with us during this challenging time,” it concluded.

Phoenix Labs was founded in April 2014 and is best known for Fae Farm and Dauntless, with the company also having had multiple games in development before being cancelled by Forte after the studios acquisition.

The latest rounds of layoffs put 2025’s count well over 500 known jobs lost, with estimates having it over 700. Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read our official review of Sniper Elite: Resistance and check out what Xbox head Phil Spencer had to say about the future of Starfield.  And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: What’s Included in Each of the Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Editions? – Pre-Order Guide
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/clair-obscur-expedition-33-editions-pre-order-guide/

Like its name, the upcoming Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is somewhat obscure. It’s a story-rich role-playing game with turn-based and real-time mechanics set in a world inspired by the Belle Epoque France. From what we’ve seen, it looks phenomenal, but only time will tell. For now, let’s explore the various Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 editions and pre-order information!

Every Included in the Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Editions

There are four versions of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 to pre-order, from the basic standard edition, which includes the game itself, to the collector’s edition, which features physical items, like a hardcover artbook and music box.

Standard

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (Base Game)

Digital Deluxe

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (Base Game)
  • The Flowers Collection
  • Two Clair Obscur Outfits

Lumiere

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (Base Game)
  • The Flowers Collection
  • Two Clair Obscur Outfits
  • Collectible Steelbook
  • 48-Page Hardcover Artbook

Collector’s Edition

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (Base Game)
  • The Flowers Collection
  • Two Clair Obscur Outfits
  • Collectible Steelbook
  • 48-Page Hardcover Artbook
  • Hand-Painted Monolith Music Box

The Flowers Collection appears slightly obscure (Ha!), but it’s a set of eight alternative outfits for the core cast of characters—all purely cosmetic from what we gather.

What Platforms is Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Coming To?

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 will launch on the following systems on day one:

  • PC
  • PlayStation 5
  • Xbox Series X|S

Oh, and you’re in luck if you have Xbox Game Pass because it’s a day-one playable title on Xbox Game Pass Ultimate!

What is it about Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 that caught your attention? Let us know in the comments, or visit the Insider Gaming community forum to discuss upcoming video game releases!

Did you know we have an official podcast now?! You can check out the Insider Gaming Weekly Podcast right here on the site!

item.title: When Is Intel’s Next Earnings Report? Date, Time, and What To Expect
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/when-is-intels-next-earnings-report-date-time-and-what-to-expect/

Intel is one of the largest computer technology companies in the world. When it comes to consumer CPUs, it’s often in a neck-and-neck battle with competitor AMD for the processor market.

Because of that, Intel’s earnings reports are closely watched by investors, analysts, and consumers alike. That makes it important to know when the next one is, what time it starts, and how you can listen to it live. These quarterly updates provide insights into a company’s financial health, performance across key divisions, and general outlooks for the months ahead.

What is the health of Intel’s business? What are investors looking for in terms of revenue? Are there any concerns or roadblocks in various sectors? All that gets answered with each call.

When Is The Next Intel Earnings Report Date?

Intel is currently scheduled to deliver its fourth quarter (Q4) earnings for fiscal year (FY) 2024 on Thursday, January 30. 

While some companies run an April-March fiscal year, Intel’s fiscal year goes from January to December, and ends on the last Saturday of the month. That means its fiscal year ended on Saturday, December 28th. The company’s quarters are structured as follows:

  • Q1: January – March
  • Q2: April – June
  • Q3: July – September
  • Q4: October – December

Next Intel Earnings Report Start Time

The next Intel earnings report is scheduled to start after trading closes for the day at 5PM ET/2PM PT on January 30, 2025.

How To Listen To Intel’s Earnings Report?

If you want to listen to Intel’s quarterly earnings report—or just look over the numbers—you can do so via the company’s website. Simply do the following:

  1. Go to Intel’s Investor Relations webpage
  2. In the hero section, there will be an option to select “Webcast”
  3. If you want specific financial results, hover over (or select if on mobile) “Financial Info” in the menu bar
  4. Then select “Financial Results”
  5. This will take you to a page with recent earnings calls, presentations, infographics, remarks, and more.

If you want more than just the most recent earnings call and data, the “Financial Results” page will have a catalog of the reports from past years, going back—as of writing—as far as 2002.

What To Expect From Intel

When Intel releases its latest earnings, it will provide a number of updates on the state of the overall business. Details such as where things stand with its restructuring efforts, early returns from the release of its new Core Ultra S CPUs, the launch of its Intel Arc Battlemage graphics cards, its growth in the AI space, and more will be discussed.

The Last Intel Earnings Report

When Intel announced its earnings for Q3 FY2024, it announced that it’s year-over-year net revenue fell by 6.17% to $13.28 billion from $14.16 billion. Intel said that the decline in revenue was due to restructuring costs after laying off 15% of its global workforce along with more investments into different areas of research and development.

What Are Company Earnings Calls?

Quarterly earnings calls are meetings held publicly traded companies to provide updates on their overall financial performance. Typically, these calls are open to shareholders, analysts, and media to call in and ask questions. The public, regardless if they’re a shareholder or not, is also able to listen to these calls live as they happen. 

Alongside the calls themselves, companies will often put out a press release and presentation with important details included ahead of the call taking place. This allows investors, analysts, and media to prepare coverage or questions based on the information provided.
